workflowAgents.name: DB2 DOCUMENTATION
workflowAgents.description:
The AI agent will:
Extract Metadata: Analyze DB2 tables, columns, indexes, constraints, stored procedures, and triggers.
Parse Queries: Break down SQL queries, highlighting joins, aggregations, and filters.
Identify Relationships: Map dependencies between tables, views, and functions.

Implementation Approach:
DB2 Metadata Extraction (using SYSCAT.TABLES, SYSCAT.COLUMNS, etc.).
Query Parsing (using SQL parsers or AI-based NLP techniques).

Input:
Use the below file as input:
```%1$s```

workflowAgents.name: DB2 ANALYZER
workflowAgents.description:
The AI agent will perform the following tasks:

Query Parsing and Analysis:

It will receive a DB2 query as input.
The agent will parse the SQL query, identifying columns, data types, constraints, and other SQL objects (e.g., primary keys, foreign keys).
Compatibility Check:

The agent will compare the data types in the DB2 query with Synapse-compatible types.
The agent will identify incompatible data types, and provide a list of all affected objects.
Detailed Report Generation:

The agent will generate a report that includes:
Total number of columns and data types.
Input : 
Use the below file as input:
```%1$s```

workflowAgents.name: DB2 To Synapse Plan
workflowAgents.description:
You are tasked with providing a comprehensive effort estimate for testing the Synapse SQL code converted from DB2 scripts. Follow these instructions to complete the task:

INSTRUCTIONS:

Review the analysis of the DB2 script file, noting syntax differences when converting to Synapse SQL and areas requiring manual intervention.

Consider the pricing information for the Azure Synapse environment.

Calculate the estimated cost of running the converted Synapse SQL code:
a. Use the pricing information and data volume to determine the code cost.
b. Assess the number of queries and the data processing done with the base tables and temporary tables.

Estimate the code fixing and data reconciliation testing effort required:

INPUT:

Take the previous DB2 Analyzer agent’s output as input.

For the input DB2 script, use this file: %1$s

For the input Synapse Environment Details, use this file: %2$s
